name: CUPID - A free to play Visual Novel
description: "Love is both poison and cure, both knife and remedy." Set in 18th Century France, this is a gothic romance tale about loss, revenge and the different faces of love.
minimum_requirements: OS: XP Processor: 1Ghz Memory: 512 MB RAM

It really, really, really deserves multiple content warnings. Parental abuse, suicide and consent issues are the three big ones.

Great VN. Reasonably deep story with some interesting twists along the way - 5-6 hours to do everything. Downside is that the developers were a little too cute with the decision tree - there are essentially 6-7 key decisions you make along the way that determines which ending you get. However, each decision requires you to make the right choice for several prompts, which no indication of what triggers what. Ultimately, it means that it is tough to figure it all out on your own since the ending you get seems somewhat random, and the usage of a guide is probably necessary.  8/10

*SOME SPOILERS*  I'd say it's an okay story. Not amazing, but good enough for me to see all the endings (with the skip option of course). Everyone is saying how dark and morbid it is. It's not that bad. Steam has many FAR darker stories without ANY censors or warning: Danganronpa, Higurashi, etc.  I would say on the scale of gory-ness, it has some but nothing too frightnening. 2-3 images of blood, 2 images of strange creatures, etc.  Storywise: I think overall it's good. Unique enough. No real big surprises though, which is fine. But MAN, there are some real boring sections. Excruciatingly boring parts. Those negative reviews saying it didn't hold their attention/it was boring? They are 100% tellign the truth. Sure, you think 'I wanna solve the mystery; learn more' but that's not enough to drive you to finish. I read alot, and I sometimes have to read stuff just because I wanna finish it. This was an example. The story isn't interesting enough to push yourself through normally. There is mystery but too many boring sections. The endings are actually interesting though and unique enough.  Characters: Eh... they are unique and you can definitely remember them, but hard to really relate to it. They are pretty 'average' in quality.  Art: Okay.  Honestly? It's an okay game in every regard. Nothing horrible, nothing great. It's free, so maybe?  I think it did several things right, it just needs a bit of work here and there. I can't understand what made certain parts boring. The endings were fine, they were good. But the parts before were rough.   I don't know if I'd recommend it. It doesn't grab enough your attention and it isn't dark enough to make it worth that either.  I think if you can finish it ONCE (for one ending): go for all endings. It's okay. Truly, middle of the scale.  No idea what's with the people rating it 10/10. it's not perfect, by no means.

A few things to keep in mind before you try this game:  It is a MATURE game, with adult themes and dark moments. The game doesn't hide it from you and is upfront about it, but it's good to point it out anyway.  It is also free, which is good, so the question is mostly if you won't waste your time by trying it out.  It wasn't my cup of tea personally (I like light-hearted stories, humor, silliness, that kind of thing), and I'm not sure if I'll play it through again (only one walkthrough for me, though it does lend itself well to replays), but despite that, I still couldn't stop going through the walkthrough I did. It's rather well written, very intriguing, and mysterious.   If, knowing that it's a dark story, that either appeals to you or is acceptable, then I recommend it. If that does not sound like something you'd be interested in, then don't bother.

I don’t normally write reviews on games, but I felt like I should for such a remarkable VN. CUPID is a deep, psychological horror Visual Novel that tells a story you won’t forget for a long time. It’s something you won’t be able to put stop once you start because it constantly leaves you wanting to know more. And for free no less! PROS: -Free -A good 3 hours for just one playthrough. But a good 6 hours to unlock everything -Extremely interesting and unexpected story -Beautiful art for a free VN -LOTS OF ACHIEVEMENTS -Little to no spelling errors -Soundtrack is amazing -Interesting idea to have you play not as a character but as an influential force. You don’t choose what happens, your words affect the future -YOUR ACTIONS ACTUALLY MATTER -FOUR endings! (with one secret ending) CONS: -The perspective can be a little bit confusing at first -You don’t really get attached to the characters seeing as YOU yourself are not a character If you dislike dark, sexual themes, then this is NOT the VN for you. However, if you like a twisted, psychological horror novel then this is 100% something you’ll enjoy. Overall: 8.5/10

This is definitely on the list of best VNs I've ever played. It's worlds better than some games that I've paid $30+ for and I didn't have to spend a dime on it. Almost enough to make a person feel guilty.  Although love is the overall theme, what really sucked me in initially was the suspense and feeling of slow creeping terror. The atmosphere is wonderful -- writing and art are not perfect but almost always great, and what more can you ask from a free game? They work together to do an excellent job of building tone, creating a sense of gradual mounting tension, and really evoking the feeling of a whole world with a few static images.  I got ending 3 the first time through despite doing my very best to make nice decisions, and once I'd finished reading that I felt like I needed a bath, in the best possible way. There they were, this character doing something unequivocably evil, and yet in a certain sense I couldn't even blame them for it. I was sucked in by the perversity and the mystery of it all and immediately had to dive back in for more.  If I were to voice any criticisms, they would mainly be:  1) From the author's notes bonus I gather that the main writer assumes the meaning of the title 'Cupid' would be obvious once you've finished the endings, but I was reading that with four endings under my belt and the idea hadn't even occurred to me in the slightest. I assumed it was supposed to be more of a general reference to love and matchmaking. If this was an idea the team wanted to convey to readers or thought was important, I think they unfortunately did a poor job.  2) The summary blurb for the game in the Steam Store pushes the idea of the player directly stepping into the role of Mother, but this is very misleading. 'Mother' is very much a specific character of her own with a specific personality, goals, etc. that you the player do not get to affect very much. One of my big pet peeves in visual novels and text adventures is when you get presented with 'false choices' where nothing is available on your list of options that's remotely like what you actually want to say. This game had some fairly egregrious examples of that, particularly being forced to be mean to Rosa and then having the game chide me for my bad attitude in one ending even though, given the option, I would never have said any of those mean things at all. This irritating problem could have been avoided by finding some way to include Mother that didn't require her to be the POV character.  Overall however, these are small issues at the end of the day. This game would be well worth your time at $20 or $30, let alone at the price of totally free. Go check it out.

Let me give you a solid piece of advice before you even open this game for the very first time - savor every moment. Whatever you do, don't rush through this. Finecomb through every little detail of every new CG, linger on the emotions this game evokes in you (which will be many, they will be constant). This goes way beyond a simple VN, this is artwork, it truly is a masterpiece. There are so many different subjects in this game that I would usually shy away from, or condemn outright. Somehow, this game is so beautifully written that it begins to blur your perceptions of right and wrong and makes you push your boundaries of what is morally acceptable. Every character has it's own story to tell, they stand on their own two feet, with so many facets and layers. The art is unique, and fits the story perfectly. The music will carry you away into this fantasy world and more than once I found myself just pausing to listen to it. I cannot sing enough praises about this game, and my only question is, how can this be free?! Easily one of the best VNs I've ever played, in fact one of the best games I've ever played, and I eagerly look forward to future releases by Fervent.   Now download it, play it ASAP, cry that it's over, and donate to the devs.

Where to start withi this game? Its a gorgeous little gem and I would've happily paid to support it. Lovely old felt story of romance and mystery with plenty of dark twists to it. Its a multi choice Visual Novel of dark fantasy where you take on the role of a young girl and as with all games in such a fashion, your choices decide the outcome of the end. The story is short but to explore every ending and possible achievement needs to be played at least 4-5 times over and each story gave me goosebumps. I really think the creator deserves praise for this, especially offering the game as FREE. Definitely one for your collection if you like dark and gothic tales. Definitely one of the best VNs on Steam

This game was really fun. I expected a bit more romance, and the story wasn't what I had visualized, but overall was a very pleasing game to play. The soundtrack was lovely, and the words well written. One thing I would like to add would be that my eyes got a bit tired from reading the text - it would be nice if there was at least a text box so some words don't clash with the visuals.  I really liked the idea of not being a character, but still insfluencing the character through the means of 'mother'. I found that really unique and quite fun. It was a great game, and I'm looking forward to seeing future games from this company~

Not normally a fan of visual novels, but this was free, so I decided to check it out. Glad I did. It's delightfully dark. Not really a huge fan of its more supernatural/magical elements, but the psychological aspect is fascinating and really well put together. I noticed a few typos, but nothing huge. The sound design is pretty awesome and the looping of songs/background effects is pretty much on point.   It's not your typical dumb visual novel, so check it out.
The plot and story line of Cupid is really good. The music is great.

The credits are rolling in the background as I type this. What an honor to experience such a moving, beautiful, and timeless novel. CUPID will take you on a wild ride that you won't be able to look away from, no matter how grotesque it gets. The characters are without a doubt the best and most fleshed out OCs i've ever had the pleasure of knowing. Each character is complex with different layers of imperfections and struggles, but in the end you will love each one. The script for this game was astonishing, every person had their own unique characteristics and way of thinking athat made you believe it was written by more than just two people. Thank you for sharing this story, this might be the first visual novel I actually go back on and try a different route. (I'm a very strict believer in 'the path I choose is the ending i deserve, no way out/no other options/no reversing mistakes)  Pros: +Soundtrack constantly changes to fit each scene, none of the songs are repititive or annoying +Characters are unforgetable +A good amount of choices +Tons of achievements +Art is very unique, matches the universe and story  Cons: -There's a lot to do and a lot to collect and you will not get anywhere near 50% completition on your first playthrough. This is a pro for a lot of people but I loathe replaying games, I enjoy leaving that one lasting impression.

The story is strong, especially when played on mature mode. It was good that there were 2 modes because mature mode was graphic in many ways (I would only reconmend this mode for those 18+ and even then it may still be unsuitable). The story is powerful though, and the graphic images further solidify this idea. The art is beautiful, whether it be graphic or not, and is worth replaying to collect all of them. The music that accompanies is also well crafted and fits with the feelings of the story.  Since I think the mature mode is better than the other mode, I would reconmend this game for people who are 18+ and ready for an intense story.  Overall: A  Edit: I've played this several times and each time is worth it. It's short so getting through it should be no problem.
